❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️ have you ever tried colorwork crochet this is the perfect piece to master the skill or show off your knowledge this sweater is worked in valley yarns northampton which provides warmth as well as clear stitch definition allowing the colorwork design to really pop it s as fun to crochet as it is to wear other patterns in the collection include forest brooks beanie woodland walker crochet socks capside crochet cardi this pattern includes a video tutorial to guide you through the important steps of the sweater pattern https //youtu be/weaj74hbbu4 **crochet hook ** us size h-8 5mm crochet hook or size needed to get gauge us size g-6 4mm crochet hook **notions ** removable stitch marker yarn needle to weave in ends scissors **yarn ** valley yarns northampton 100% wool 100g/247 yds 1 a 7 7 8 9 11 13 15 16 17 balls ocean heather b 1 1 1 1 2 2 2 2 2 balls natural c 1 1 1 1 1 1 2 2 2 balls autumn heather d 1 ball light grey **yardage ** extra small 2 470 yds small 2 470 yds medium 2 715 yds large 2 965 yds 1x 3 705 yds 2x 4 200 yds 3x 4 940 yds 4x 5 185 yds 5x 5 435 yds **abbreviations/stitches ** blo back loop only chain chain decrease d decrease d increase d increase d repeat repeat round s round s single_crochet single_crochet sc3tog single_crochet 3 together 2 sts decreased ssc split single_crochet skip skip slip_stitch slip_stitch ssc2tog split single_crochet 2 together 1 st decreased st s stitch es **gauge ** 13 sts and 15 row = 4 in split single_crochet using larger hook **measurements/sizes ** finished bust sizes extra small 37 94 cm small 39 5 100 cm medium 41 5 105 cm large 46 75 119 cm 1x 51 75 131 cm 2x 56 5 143 cm 3x 60 5 154 cm 4x 64 5 164 cm 5x 68 25 173 cm fits with 2-6 positive
